question: Which state has raised the stipend of unemployed youth to Rs.5000, under its Yuva Swabhiman Yojana?
explanation:
The flagship scheme of the state government of Madhya Pradesh, Yuva Swabhiman Yojana has been revived recently. The state has raised the stipend of unemployed youth to Rs.5000 and has also decided to provide 365 guaranteed workdays for them.
Yuva Swabhiman Yojana was launched by the state government of Madhya Pradesh in January 2019, which is aimed at providing 100 days of work and stipend to unemployed youth of the state. After the amendment, the scheme is expected to generate 25000 new jobs to suitable youth after training.
